attributes.action: Give us a fairer system for this year’s A Level and GCSE results
attributes.additional_details:
Because of COVID-19, everyone who couldn’t take their exams are having our results decided by a computer algorithm, which doesn’t look at our individual performance and marks us down for which school we went to.
About 40% of A-level assessments have been downgraded, potentially impacting the futures of thousands of young people. This will probably happen for GCSE as well.
This is not right, and I’m calling on the Government to urgently sort out this injustice.
attributes.background:
At a minimum, the Government must ensure there is:
*No “marking down” of individual pupils based on them having gone to a different school
*A free appeal system open to any pupil
*More weight given to our own teachers’ assessments

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that GCSE and A-level students will receive their centre assessment grades: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/gcse-and-a-level-students-to-receive-centre-assessment-grades

Prior to this announcement being made, we had published the following petitions, calling for similar actions to your request: 

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Allow free and accessible appeals of GCSE and A Level calculated grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334013
